player_decision.reason: On the button 3-handed with ~10.5 BB and K7o, a min-raise applies pressure on both blinds while not overcommitting; better than limping, and shoving is a bit wide versus two players.
6h2c is a weak hand preflop facing a 20 bet in a 3-handed tournament. Folding preserves stack and looks for better spots rather than getting committed with a long way from the blinds.
Hand 4d6d is speculative and out of position; calling the 10 more chips for a chance to see a flop is cheap and avoids committing more with a marginal hand. Will evaluate on the flop.

I have a marginal pair (6s) with a weak kicker on a 9-8-6 board. Prefer to control the pot and see the turn rather than build it with a vulnerable hand — call/check to evaluate further and avoid risking many chips to better pairs/straights.
C-bet 2/3 pot with an open-ended straight draw on a connected flop, leveraging initiative and setting up a turn shove if called (SPR ~2).

I have middle pair (6s) with a weak kicker. Facing a single bet into a 75 pot, calling 30 gives good pot odds and lets me see the turn to reevaluate; raising or shoving is too risky with this marginal hand.
I have a weak one-pair (6s) with very few clean outs on the paired turn (6c 9s 8h 8c). Opponent has shown aggression; no value in raising. Call to see the river without committing my stack.

Check back to realize equity with our 8-out straight draw. With SPR ~0.5, villain is priced to call most pairs/draws, so fold equity on a shove is low. Preserving stack while taking a free card is higher EV and safer for tournament life.

I have two pair (8s and 6s) but the river Ace and earlier betting line allow many hands to beat me (A,9,6x,8x). With pot ~105 and remaining stack 55, calling keeps the pot manageable and reaches showdown to see if my hand holds. A raise or shove would risk more on a likely stronger range.
Busted draw with K-high; turn checked through and river Ace is great for our range as the preflop raiser. Shoving 55 into 105 maximizes fold equity against 9x/6x and missed draws, needing ~34% folds.

Board (6 9 8 8 A) and opponent’s betting line indicate strong value (A,8,9 or better). My pair of sixes has poor showdown equity and required ~34% to call. Folding preserves my stack and tournament life.
